title: More Moons For a Planet With Many Moons

content.en: Everyone knows Earth has one moon. That's why it's called 'the moon'. It goes around our planet. People have gone to the moon in rockets. How do we know something is a moon? It goes around and around a planet or something that isn't a star.
content.tw: 地球只有一個月亮，但只要不斷繞著行星，又不是星星的物體就叫月亮，所以外太空裡有很多顆。

content.en: Some planets have many moons. Which has the most? The biggest planet has 95 moons. But Saturn has more.
content.tw: 有一些行星有很多顆月亮，最大的行星有 95 顆，但土星有更多!

content.en: You know Saturn. It has rings around it. It has 146 moons. But wait! Scientists found it has 128 more moons! So Saturn has 274 moons. And maybe there are more!
content.tw: 土星的土星環很有名，但你知道它有 274 顆月亮嗎? 科學家說可能還有更多!

content.en: Saturn's biggest moon is more than 5,000 kilometers wide. Earth's moon is 3,474 kilometers wide. Saturn's moon is bigger! It's bigger than the planet next to the Sun too!
content.tw: 土星最大的月亮 5000 公里寬，比地球還要大顆，也比太陽旁邊的行星大!

content.en: Saturn's biggest moon and one of its smaller moons have water! The smaller moon shoots water into space! Scientists want to study these moons more.
content.tw: 那顆大月亮和另一顆小月亮都有水，小月亮還會噴水到太空，現在科學家正在研究中。

content.en: Saturn's moons are cool! And there's a lot to find out about them!
content.tw: 土星的月亮很酷，還有很多事要研究!

vocabulary.preface: 科學家發現土星有兩百多顆月球繞著它轉，有夠熱鬧。

content.text:
1. planet 行星。
Hey, look at that bright star! 你看那顆好亮的星星!
That's actually not a star. 它其實不是恆星。
It's a planet. 而是行星。
How do you know? 你怎麼知道?

2. star 恆星。
Take a closer look. Is it twinkling? 你仔細看。它有在閃爍嗎?
No. 沒有。
That's because it's much closer to Earth. 那是因為它離地球近很多。
Stars are very far away. 恆星距離非常遠。

3. study 研究。
Have you studied space and stars? 你研究過太空跟星星?
Well, that's about all I know about stars. 我知道的也就只有那樣。

4. next to 在旁邊。
So what's that planet next to the sun? 所以那顆太陽旁邊的行星是什麼呢?
It's Venus. 那是金星。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you know any of the planets?
planet行星 star恆星 study研究 next to在旁邊

content.en: Today is World Bicycle Day. What's that sound? That's right. It's a YouBike! It's a bike people can rent.
content.tw: 世界腳踏車日就是今天! 一起租 YouBike 來騎吧 !

content.en: Many people rent YouBikes. They ride them to school. They ride them to work. In Taipei, people rent YouBikes two hundred thousand times a day!
content.tw: 台灣很多人租 YouBike 上學或上班，台北人一天總共借 20 萬次 YouBike!

content.en: It's important for bike riders to wear a helmet. Bikes are on the road with many scooters and cars. When bikes are hit by a scooter or car, helmets can stop bike riders from getting badly hurt. But, there's a problem. Many bike riders don't wear helmets. And that's not safe.
content.tw: 騎腳踏車在路上時，安全帽能保護騎士，非常重要，問題是大部分腳踏車騎士都不戴安全帽!

content.en: Some people say helmets are too big to carry all day. But Taiwan wants bike riders to wear helmets. What can Taiwan do?
content.tw: 有一些人抱怨帽子太大不好攜帶，政府該怎麼鼓勵騎士戴安全帽呢?

content.en: How about selling helmets that fold? Spain, France, and the UK have them. People can put them in their bags! Cool! Or how about having helmets for rent, like YouBikes? Other countries do this! In Japan, there are machines that have helmets for rent.
content.tw: 賣可以摺疊放包包的安全帽如何? 西班牙、法國跟英國都有使用，或是可以出租安全帽，跟日本一樣!

content.en: Your safety is very important. Whenever you ride a bike, please wear a helmet! Happy World Bicycle Day!
content.tw: 安全第一! 不管何時騎腳踏車，都請戴上安全帽! 世界腳踏車日快樂!

vocabulary.preface: 騎腳踏車戴安全帽，又帥又可以保命!

content.text:
1. scooter 摩托車。
Look at you, riding that scooter like a hero! 你看你，騎在車上像個英雄!

2. wear 穿戴。
But where's your helmet? 但是你的安全帽呢?
Here, under the seat. 在這裡，椅子底下。
You've got to wear it! 你一定要戴!
Not wearing it could cost you a 500 NT fine. 不戴可能吃五百塊的罰單。

3. hurt 受傷。
Yikes! That's a lot! 討厭，那很多呢!
It is. 是很多。
And you don't want your head to get hurt. 你可不想腦袋受傷吧。
Okay, okay. Now how do I look? 好啦，現在我看起來怎麼樣?

4. all day 整天。
Very cool! 很酷。
Good, I'll wear it all day. 真好，那我戴一整天。
Wow, that would be something. 那會很特別。

vocabulary.postscript:
跟我一起讀單字吧。

content.en: In South America, a tree's roots grow above the ground. They look like octopus legs. Some people say the tree walks! Is that true?
content.tw: 南美洲有一棵樹的樹根突出地面，像是章魚腳，甚至有人說它會走路!

content.en: In movies, trees can run and dance. Sometimes they fight! Real trees move, but not like that.
content.tw: 電影裡的樹會跳舞、跑步，甚至打架，真正的樹做不到，但它們也會移動!

content.en: First, baby trees grow up, up, up. Then they reach out with their branches. They are looking for sunlight. It helps them make food.
content.tw: 小樹苗會努力往上長高，伸長自己的樹枝尋找陽光。

content.en: The roots of the trees move too. The roots of most trees grow in the ground. They look for water. But the trees stay in the same place.
content.tw: 樹根也會移動，大部分樹根都在地底下，它們會蔓延尋找水分。

content.en: Trees can't walk. No. But forests can move! Wind, birds, and other animals carry tree seeds to new places. After a long time, those seeds grow into new trees. Slowly, forests move.
content.tw: 樹不會自己走路，但是風、鳥和其他的動物，會帶著種子移動到新的地方。

content.en: Now the Earth is getting warmer. Some trees can't live in the same place anymore. So people plant them in better places. This helps the trees grow better. Slowly, forests move.
content.tw: 現在地球不斷暖化，有一些樹不適合當地的氣候，於是人們會在別的地方重新栽種，長久下來，森林就會慢慢移動。

content.en: Trees don't walk. They don't run, dance, or fight like in the movies. But they move. Yes. Slowly, they move together as a forest!
content.tw: 樹不會走路，也不會像電影裡那樣跑、跳舞或打架。但它們確實會移動。是的，它們會以森林的形式，一起慢慢地移動！

vocabulary.preface: 樹林不會自己移動，但是藉著動物和人類，它也能慢慢擴散。

content.text:
1. seed 種子。
Is this the tree that you grew from a tiny seed?
這棵是你從小小種子種出來的樹嗎?
Yeah, crazy, isn't it? 對啊，滿狂的吧?

2. ground 地面。
It grew so fast over the years. 幾年來它長得好快!
Yeah, the branches are way above the ground. 對啊，樹枝都離地面很遠了。

3. bird 鳥類。
And there's a bird's nest up there! 而且上面有鳥巢。
I know. Animals love this tree. 我知道，動物都很喜歡這棵樹。

4. root 根部。
How did you make it so strong? 你怎麼讓它變這麼強壯?
I did nothing except giving it water. 我除了澆水什麼也沒做。
I guess plants just take root and grow. 我想植物會自己生根然後生長。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字都很簡單。
seed種子 ground地面 bird鳥類 root根部

content.en: Taiwan has its own butterfly. It's the purple crow butterfly. In sunlight, its color changes all the time. Japanese scientists call its changing color "magic light."
content.tw: 紫斑蝶是台灣特有的蝴蝶，翅膀會在陽光下變色，日本科學家稱這個現象為幻色。

content.en: In the spring and fall, hundreds of thousands of these butterflies get up and go! They fly two or three hundred kilometers each time! But the butterflies sometimes fly over freeways.
content.tw: 每到春天和秋天，牠們會起飛去旅行，一次會飛 2 到 3 百公里! 但牠們有時候會經過高速公路!

content.en: Freeways are dangerous for butterflies. Cars going faster than fifty kilometers an hour can pull them down!
content.tw: 高速公路超級危險，時速超過 50 的車子會掀起大風，把蝴蝶從空中捲下來撞車!

content.en: This spring, Yunlin County was ready to help the butterflies. It put up a tall and very long green net on one side of a freeway. The net helps keep the butterflies safe.
content.tw: 雲林縣伸出援手，在高速公路邊，架一道又高又長的綠色網子，保護蝴蝶安全。

content.en: The county closed a freeway lane for almost five hours. It was next to the net. Cars went by slowly in the other lanes. More than 30,000 butterflies flew by that day. At one time, 690 butterflies flew by every minute! Wow!
content.tw: 其中一個車道還會關閉快五個小時，讓超過 3 萬隻蝴蝶通過，一分鐘大概有 690 隻!

content.en: In the spring and fall, look up! Maybe you'll see the magic light of Taiwan's purple crow butterflies!
content.tw: 春天和秋天時，抬頭看看！也許你會看到台灣紫斑蝶的幻色光芒！

vocabulary.preface: 為了讓紫斑蝶順利遷徙，高速公路每年都會關閉車道一段時間。

content.text:
1. fly 飛行。
Whoa, so many butterflies! 這麼多蝴蝶!
What's going on here? 發生了什麼事?
Those are purple crow butterflies, 那些是紫斑蝶，
flying north to breed. 飛往北邊去繁殖。
Marvelous, right? 很壯觀吧?

2. thousand 千。
There must be thousands of them! 一定有好幾千隻!
I've never seen anything like it! 我從來沒見過這種現象。

3. spring 春天。
Some scientists say there are nearly 400 thousand of them.
有的科學家說將近四十萬隻。
Wow, and they do this each time spring comes? 牠們每年春天來時都這樣?
Yeah, they do. 是啊。

4. sunlight 陽光。
Don't they look beautiful in the sunlight? 牠們在陽光下是不是好漂亮?
Indeed. 真的是。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天學到哪些單字?
fly飛行 thousand千 spring春天 sunlight陽光

title: A Very Important Place You Don't Know About

content.en: Seagrass grows in the ocean. It grows where the bottom of the ocean gets some sunlight. That's up to fifty meters deep. Seagrass fields can grow in the middle of the ocean!
content.tw: 海草長在照得到陽光的海底，可能是有 50 公尺深的海中央!

content.en: Seagrass fields are very important. They clean dirty water. They feed and give homes to many animals. And they take in carbon. That means they fight climate change. Seagrass fields protect our Earth.
content.tw: 海草會淨化海水、吸收碳、提供動物食物跟棲息地，它們對抗地球暖化，非常重要。

content.en: The Saya de Malha Bank is a little bigger than Taiwan. It is one of the biggest seagrass fields in the ocean. That means it's one of the most important places on Earth! But most of us don't know about it.
content.tw: Saya de Malha 是世界最大的海草生長地，比台灣還大，但很少人知道。

content.en: For hundreds of years, ships didn't go there. People were scared. Old maps say "Here Be Monsters."
content.tw: 好幾百年來船隻都不敢經過，因為古老地圖說那裏有怪獸。

content.en: But now, people from Taiwan, Thailand, and Sri Lanka go there to fish. The way they fish hurts the seagrass! It hurts sharks, dugongs, dolphins, and many other animals too.
content.tw: 但現在有太多各國的漁民去那裡捕魚，反而傷害海草、海豚跟其他的生物，該怎麼辦呢?

content.en: The Saya de Malha Bank is getting hurt! To protect Earth, this seagrass field needs to be healthy. What can we do to help it?
content.tw: Saya de Malha 海岸正受到傷害！為了保護地球，這片海草地需要保持健康。我們能做些什麼來幫助它呢？

vocabulary.preface: 這塊海草生長地，範圍比台灣還大。

content.text:
1) dolphin 海豚。
A friend of mine saw dolphins yesterday! 我一個朋友昨天看到海豚!
That's awesome! 真驚人!
Where did he see them? 他在哪裡看到的?
Somewhere northeast of Keelung Harbor. 基隆港東北方某個地方。

2) sea 大海。
Out on the sea? 在外海嗎?
Yeah, he was sailing when they showed up. 對，海豚出現時他正在駕帆船。
Wow, your friend is living the dream life! 哇，你的朋友過夢幻的生活!

3) fish 釣魚。
Yeah, sometimes he goes fishing on his boat too. 有時候他還駕船去釣魚。
Tell him to save me a seat on that boat! 告訴他幫我在船上留個位子。

4) bigger 更大的
His boat is not much bigger than your bathtub. 他的船沒有比你的澡缸大多少。
I don't care. I want to see dolphins. 我不在乎，我要看海豚。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很容易記。
dolphin海豚 sea大海 fish釣魚 bigger更大的

content.en: Have you seen big groups eat beautiful meals on a road? These are roadside banquets. People have them for new babies, weddings, and other events.
content.tw: 你看過一群人在路邊吃大餐嗎?台灣慶祝新生兒或喜宴時會舉辦，那叫做辦桌。

content.en: Long ago, everyone helped. People brought food. Chefs cooked it. People brought chairs and tables too. Kids helped set them up. It was a fun way to join a group!
content.tw: 以前參加辦桌的人要自己準備食物跟桌椅，大人小孩一起來幫忙。

content.en: Now, chefs and their helpers bring everything. They do everything. They make many Taiwanese dishes. They cut vegetables into flowers for the tables. People come to eat, talk, and make new friends.
content.tw: 現在廚師會處理一切，準備台式料理，布置場地，大家只要負責吃飯聊天!

content.en: But there are fewer roadside banquets now. It's hot outside! More banquets are at restaurants or hotels. Some people say roadside banquets will go away soon.
content.tw: 但是天氣越來越熱，大家喜歡到飯店或餐廳聚餐，辦桌會不會消失呢?

content.en: But one Taiwanese chef wants other countries to have these banquets. She has a restaurant in the U.S. It has roadside banquet food. She says people know about stinky tofu and beef noodles. But Taiwan has much more to eat!
content.tw: 一位台灣大廚不想看它消失，她在美國一家中餐廳製作辦桌料理，告訴大家台灣不是只有臭豆腐跟牛肉麵!

content.en: Would you like to go to one of these banquets? You'll eat delicious Taiwanese food and make new friends!
content.tw: 你想參加一場這樣的辦桌嗎？你將會吃到美味的台灣食物，還能交到新朋友！

vocabulary.preface: 台灣早年碰到喜慶或是宮廟活動，常常請大廚和助手來辦桌，菜色豐盛。

content.text:
1. wedding 婚禮。
I've been invited to a wedding banquet. 我收到喝喜酒的邀請。
That'll be fun! 會很好玩喔。
The food is usually amazing. 食物通常很棒!
I hope so. 我也希望。

2. dish 一道菜。
You'll probably get 10 dishes, 很可能有十道菜，
stuff like chicken soup and Buddha Jumps Over the Wall. 例如雞湯跟佛跳牆。
That sounds more like a kung fu movie than a dish!
聽起來更像功夫電影而不是菜名。

3. restaurant 餐廳。
I know, right? But it's very delicious. 我知道，不過它很好吃。
Do you know which restaurant it's at? 你知道喜酒在哪家餐廳嗎?

4. hotel 旅館。
I think it's in a 5-star hotel. 我想在一家五星級飯店裡。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有喝過喜酒嗎? 來讀單字。
wedding婚禮 dish一道菜 restaurant餐廳 hotel旅館

title: Young Students Get Free Milk in Taipei

content.en: Taipei knows milk is good for kids. It makes bones and teeth strong and healthy.
content.tw: 牛奶對小朋友很重要，能讓骨頭跟牙齒更強壯。

content.en: Taipei wants kids to drink milk and grow up healthy and tall! Now kids in elementary schools and preschools in Taipei can get milk. And they get it for free!
content.tw: 台北市政府希望小朋友多喝牛奶長高，現在小學跟幼稚園學生都能免費喝牛奶!

content.en: These kids can get cow's milk or soy milk. Why can they get soy milk? Well, some kids can't drink cow's milk. It makes their stomachs hurt.
content.tw: 喝牛奶會肚子痛的話，也可以選擇喝豆漿。

content.en: The kids can get free milk once a week. They can get it for forty weeks, when there's school. There's no free milk during winter and summer breaks.
content.tw: 每星期會有一瓶免費牛奶，除了寒暑假之外，可以喝 40 個禮拜。

content.en: But Taipei's schools are not giving kids the free milk. Kids or their parents can get it at some convenience store chains and supermarket chains. The city gives kids a card to get it. Getting free milk is fun!
content.tw: 台北市會送出票券，小朋友或家長可以到便利商店跟超市兌換。

content.en: If kids don't get milk one week, can they get two drinks the next week? Nope. After 11:59 on Sunday night, the week's free milk is gone!
content.tw: 但牛奶一定要在禮拜天晚上之前兌換，拖到下個禮拜的話，免費牛奶就沒了!

content.en: Do you go to elementary school in Taipei? Remember to get your free milk or soy milk!
content.tw: 你/妳是台北市的小學生嗎？記得去領取免費的牛奶或豆漿喔！

vocabulary.preface: 台北市學童每星期可以領一次牛奶或是豆漿。

content.text:
1) stomach 肚子或是胃。
Do you still drink milk in the morning? 你早上還是喝牛奶?
No, usually soy milk these days. 不了，這段時間都喝豆漿。
It's easier on my stomach. 對我的胃比較好。

2) bone 骨頭。
I stick with cow's milk. Old habit. 我堅持喝牛奶，習慣了。
Plus it's good for the bones. 而且對骨頭好。

3) strong 強壯的。
True. And teeth too. 那是真的，對牙齒也好。
We've gotta stay strong as we grow older. 我們年齡增加更要身體強壯。
But I do cheat a little. 不過我會小小作弊。

4) drink 喝。
I blend milk with banana or mango. 我會把香蕉或是芒果打進牛奶裡。
That sounds good! 聽起來不錯。
Yeah, I can drink three glasses every day. 對啊，我一天可以喝三杯。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡牛奶還是豆漿?
stomach肚子或是胃 bone骨頭 strong強壯的 drink喝

content.en: Do you have a backbone? Yes! People have backbones. Birds, fish, and some other kinds of animals have backbones too. Backbones make us vertebrates. Without backbones, we'd be like jelly!
content.tw: 你有脊椎嗎?當然啦! 人類、鳥類跟許多動物都有脊椎，不然我們會像果凍一樣!

content.en: But many animals don't have backbones. They are invertebrates! Invertebrates are bugs, worms, and more!
content.tw: 但許多動物是無脊椎動物，像是軟軟的蟲子們。

content.en: A newspaper has a contest. Readers choose the "Invertebrate of the Year." This year, readers chose from ten interesting animals. One was an earthworm. This earthworm can be three meters long! Another was a fly. This fly pretends to be a bee. It dances like a bee!
content.tw: 一家報社讓讀者票選無脊椎動物，很多有趣的參賽者，像是 3 公尺長的蚯蚓，還有學蜜蜂跳舞的蒼蠅!

content.en: Many people chose an invertebrate. The winner was the tardigrade! It's very small. It's as small as a grain of sand. It's cute, too. It looks like a bear or a pig with eight legs.
content.tw: 最後的贏家叫做水熊蟲，跟沙子一樣小，長得像是有八隻腳的小熊或小豬!

content.en: But the tardigrade is very, very strong. Being very cold or very hot won't hurt it. It can live in space!
content.tw: 水熊蟲很強壯，可以在極冷或極熱的環境生存，甚至外太空!

content.en: Scientists are studying tardigrades. What other amazing things will we learn about this year's "Invertebrate of the Year"?
content.tw: 科學家們正在研究水熊蟲。關於今年的「年度無脊椎動物」，我們還會學到哪些驚人的事情呢？

vocabulary.preface: 無脊椎動物包括昆蟲，蝸牛，水母等等。

content.text:
1) bug 蟲。
There's a bug in my salad! 有一隻蟲在我的沙拉裡面。
Ew, that's gross! 好噁喔!
Let me see what it is… It's a fly. 我來看看是什麼...是蒼蠅。

2) as small as 一樣小。
But it's small. 不過牠很小。
As small as an ant. 跟螞蟻一樣小。
Whatever it is, I'm done with this salad. 不管是什麼，沙拉我不吃了。

3) bee 蜜蜂。
Maybe we just skip our lunch? 也許我們就放棄中飯?
No, I'm still waiting for my pizza! 不要，我還在等披薩!
I once had a bee fly into my soda can. 有一次還有蜜蜂飛進我的汽水罐。

4) newspaper 報紙。
Did you get stung? 你被叮了嗎?
I did, and the story made it into the newspaper! 沒錯，而且我的故事還上了報紙!

vocabulary.postscript:
今天這四個單字你記住了嗎?
bug蟲 as small as一樣小 bee蜜蜂 newspaper報紙

title: Elementary School Kids Think About Jobs

content.en: What do you want to be when you grow up? Do you want to be a chef, a police officer, or an artist? Or do you want to be a teacher, a musician, or a doctor?
content.tw: 你長大想做什麼? 廚師、警察、藝術家嗎?或是老師、音樂家跟醫生呢?

content.en: This year, almost three thousand elementary school kids in Taiwan said what job they want when they grow up. Number one is an athlete! Number two is an eSports athlete. Number three is a pastry chef. Did you choose any of these three jobs?
content.tw: 今年，快 3000 個小學生說他們的夢想工作是運動員! 再來是電競選手跟甜點烘焙師!

content.en: These kids also said what was important to them about a job. It has to be about something they are interested in. What they do in the job has to be interesting too. And they want the pay to be high!
content.tw: 這些小朋友說最重要的，就是工作要符合興趣，內容有趣，薪水也要高!

content.en: The kids said they don't want to be farmers, fishers, or forest workers. But those jobs can be interesting too! Farmers and fishers help Taiwan's people have healthy food. Forest workers keep Taiwan's land healthy for people to enjoy.
content.tw: 他們不想當農夫、漁夫或在森林工作，不過這些工作對台灣很有貢獻，其實也很有趣!

content.en: It's fun to think about what you want to be. You can choose from many, many jobs!
content.tw: 思考你將來想做什麼是很有趣的。你可以從非常、非常多的工作中選擇！

vocabulary.preface: 小學生覺得什麼工作最好? 很多人說想當運動員。

content.text:
1. choose 選擇。
If you could be anything, 要是你能做任何事，
what job would you choose? 你會選哪一種工作?
Hm...tough one. 這有點難。
I think being a chef would be fun. 我想當大廚應該很好玩。

2. artist 藝術家。
I already do most of the cooking at home. 我現在大部分都在家裡做飯。
And I love it. 並且很喜歡。
What about you? 你呢?
I'd go for an artist. 我想當藝術家。

3. interested 有興趣。
I didn't know you're interested in art. 我不知道你對藝術有興趣。
I'm not. 我沒有。
But I heard they make big money. 但是我聽說他們賺大錢。

4. doctor 醫生。
For that, becoming a doctor maybe better. 想要那樣，當醫生可能比較好。
Hey, we could be anything, right? 我們可以做任何事的，對吧?

vocabulary.postscript:
你會怎麼做選擇呢?
choose 選擇 artist 藝術家 interested 有興趣 doctor 醫生

content.en: No one knows when an earthquake might happen. But there are three things we must do when an earthquake happens: drop, cover, and hold on. Dropping to the floor can keep us safe.
content.tw: 地震不能預測，但我們知道怎麼應對，要趕快蹲到地上，找東西掩護並抓緊!

content.en: A man was filming some fish in the ocean. In the video, the fish are swimming. Then they stop! An earthquake happens. The fish drop to the ocean floor! They lie down together!
content.tw: 一個男人拍攝魚群，他拍到在地震發生的時候，魚群迅速下降，一起躺在海底。

content.en: The fish drop to the floor like we must drop during earthquakes! In the ocean, earthquakes can make very big waves. Dropping to the ocean floor can keep fish safe from these waves.
content.tw: 地震來的時候會掀起大浪，魚貼近海底會比較安全，和我們蹲到地上一樣。

content.en: It's very strange for these fish to drop to the ocean floor and lie down together. Every day, they move a lot. They don't rest together at night. They don't lie on the ocean floor together.
content.tw: 這個現象非常奇怪，魚群平常每天一起移動，但絕不會躺著休息。

content.en: Scientists say maybe these fish can feel when an earthquake is coming! They are studying the fish. Maybe they will learn how fish feel an earthquake coming.
content.tw: 科學家認為魚可能可以預測地震，也許我們能向牠們學習!

content.en: If scientists can tell us when earthquakes are coming, we'll be safer, thanks to fish!
content.tw: 如果科學家能告訴我們地震何時會來，那麼多虧了魚，我們將會更安全！

vocabulary.preface: 海裡的魚能知道發生地震，並且還會自我保護。

content.text:
1. feel 感覺。
Do you feel that? 你感覺到了嗎?
It's an earthquake! 地震!
And a big one! 很大的地震!
Should we get under the desk? 我們要躲在桌子底下嗎?

2. lie down 躺下來。
Too late now. 太遲了。
It's already stopped. 已經停了。
Whew, that was scary! 真可怕!
I think I need to lie down. 我覺得我需要躺下來。

3. strange 奇怪的。
We should have dropped to the ground. 我們應該蹲下來的。
That would be a bit strange. 那會有點奇怪。
No, it's not. It's what the scientists say. 不會，科學家都那樣說。

4. happen 發生。
Okay, I'll probably do it, if it happens again. 好吧，如果再發生我也許照做。
It's not if. It's when. 不是如果，是當它再發生的時候。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字
feel感覺 lie down躺下來 strange奇怪的 happen發生

content.en:
Ground control: All systems are ready... Ten... nine... eight ...

Narrator: Taiwan is getting its first rocket launch site! Rockets going to space will be launched from there.
content.tw: 台灣將要蓋第一座火箭發射場，之後可以從這裡發射火箭到太空。

content.en: Scientists looked at many places. They thought very hard. They needed to find the best place.
content.tw: 科學家考慮過許多地點，想找個最好的。

content.en: What things make a good launch site? One: the place is big. Two: it is far from places with many people. Three: it has no animals that must be kept safe. Four: it is easy to build on.
content.tw: 蓋火箭發射場需要什麼呢?空間要大，離人群跟動物很遠，而且施工容易。

content.en: They chose a small village in Pingtung. This place has all of the things for a good launch site. It is perfect for rocket launches!
content.tw: 屏東一個小鎮滿足所有條件，被選中蓋火箭發射場。

content.en:
Ground control: Seven... six... five... four...

Narrator: The launch site will take about six years to finish. After that, rockets can take off from Taiwan!
content.tw: 六年工程後，火箭就能從台灣起飛!

content.en: Scientists also want people to learn about space. They want everyone to know what Taiwan is doing in space. So they may build a space museum in the village. Kids and their families could visit and learn!
content.tw: 科學家也會蓋一間太空博物館，幫助大家更了解太空科技。

content.en:
This rocket launch site is a big step for rockets and science in Taiwan!

Ground control: Three... two... one... launch!
content.tw: 這座火箭發射場是台灣火箭和科學的一大步！

vocabulary.preface: 屏東的火箭發射場，將協助台灣發展太空科技。

content.text:
1. launch 發射。
I really want to see a rocket launch one day. 我真想有一天看到火箭發射。
In the movies, people watch it from boats! 在電影裡，人們在船上看!

2. take off 起飛。
It's so romantic! 很浪漫呢!
You see the rocket take off at night, with the stars and the moon, so beautiful! 你看到火箭在夜空中起飛，還有星星跟月亮，好美!

3. science 科學。
Romantic? It's a rocket, not a love story! 浪漫?那是火箭，可不是愛情小說!
That's serious science. 是很嚴肅的科學。

4. space 太空。
Science can be romantic. 科學也可以浪漫。
Big engines, big dreams. 大引擎，大夢想。
And a big outer space too. 還有好大的外太空。

vocabulary.postscript:
你會做飛上太空的夢嗎? 我們先來讀單字。
launch發射 take off起飛 science科學 space太空

options: a. It's close to a city
c. It's easy to build on.

title: Goodbye to Antarctica's Big Red Bus

content.en: Antarctica is at the bottom of the world. It's a cold and windy place. A red and white bus called Ivan worked there. He took people from planes to research stations.
content.tw: 南極是風大寒冷的地方，那裏有一台紅白相間的依凡巴士，依凡巴士負責載科學家到研究站。

content.en: Ivan is very big. He is as tall as a house. His six tires almost are as tall as polar bears! People climb a ladder to get in the bus.
content.tw: 依凡很高大，像一棟房子，6 個輪子也有北極熊那麼高，乘客需要爬梯子上車。

content.en: When Ivan was working, he was slow. But he was strong. Inside, people stayed warm. They sat on soft seats. Jazz music played. Everyone loved Ivan. They put funny stickers everywhere inside.
content.tw: 依凡速度不快，但坐在裡面溫暖又舒適，還能聽爵士音樂，大家都愛依凡。

content.en: But after working thirty years, Ivan was old. He was hard to fix. A new bus came. Ivan had to stop working.
content.tw: 但依凡 30 歲很老了，變得難修理，所以他將退休，交班給新的巴士。

content.en: Many people were sad. They didn't want Ivan to be thrown away. A research station worker tried to find a new home for him. The man wanted to save him.
content.tw: 大家捨不得將他丟掉，一個研究站工作者想幫依凡找新家。

content.en: Good news came! Ivan is safe. And maybe he will go to the International Antarctic Centre in New Zealand.
content.tw: 依凡安全了! 他退休後可能會住進紐西蘭的南極中心，開啟新生活。

content.en: There, kids will come to see him. They will smile and take photos with him. They will love Ivan!
content.tw: 在那裡，孩子們會來看他。他們會笑著和他合照。他們會愛上依凡！

vocabulary.preface: 對南極的科學家大有貢獻的依凡巴士，退休之後也不會寂寞。

content.text:
1) windy 颳風的。
It's so hot today! 今天好熱!
I wish I were in Antartica. 我希望我在南極洲。
You wouldn't like it there. 你不會喜歡那裡的。
It's super cold and windy. 那裡超級冷，又颳風。

2) place 地方。
I like having some wind. 我喜歡有點兒風。
No, when there's wind in a place like Antarctica, 不，在南極洲那種地方，
it's more like a storm. 颳風時就像暴風。

3) polar bear 北極熊。
At least I'd get to see polar bears. 至少可以看到北極熊。
Yeah, if they can swim 20,000 kilometers across the ocean.
對，要是牠們能游過兩萬公里的海洋。

4) take photos 照相。
Oh … I forgot that only penguins are there! 我忘了那裡只有企鵝。
Be sure to take photos with them! 一定要跟牠們照相喔!

vocabulary.postscript:
來讀單字。
windy颳風的 place地方 polar bear北極熊 take photos照相

content.en: People use AI every day. It writes words and makes pictures. It finds information online. And soon, it will help teachers in New Taipei City and Hsinchu City!
content.tw: 大家每天用 AI 寫文章、做圖片或找資料，很快地，新北跟新竹的老師也會用 AI 幫忙 !

content.en: These cities are working together. They will teach teachers to use AI. It will help teachers teach students more about culture. It will also help them teach Indigenous students their languages and cultures.
content.tw: 兩個城市將教老師用 AI，幫學生學習不同文化，還能讓原住民學生學會自己的語言。

content.en: Why do the cities want AI to help teachers? Well, teachers work very hard now! They plan what to teach every day. They plan how to teach it. Planning lessons takes a lot of time. Planning these new lessons will take a lot more time. But AI can help teachers plan very fast.
content.tw: 老師們非常辛苦，每天花非常多的時間規劃教學內容，現在 AI可以幫忙!

content.en: AI can find information fast on culture and Indigenous languages and cultures. It can find how to teach them.
content.tw: AI可以很快找到文化資訊，還能計畫怎麼教導學生最有效。

content.en: After teachers learn to use AI, they will go to some schools. They will teach other teachers to use it. Schools in the two cities will share information.
content.tw: 兩個城市將一起合作，老師學會用 AI之後，就到其他的學校教別的老師。

content.en: Soon, AI may change teaching and learning!
content.tw: 很快地，AI 可能會改變教學與學習！

vocabulary.preface: 人工智慧是老師的得力助手，可以幫忙準備教材。

content.text:
1. teacher 老師。
I love AI! 我愛人工智慧!
It's like having a teacher that never sleeps. 就好像有個從來不睡覺的老師。
I agree. It's so useful! 我同意，它真有用。

2. fast 快速的。
I ask my AI all kinds of questions. 我問人工智慧各種問題。
And it gives answers very fast! 它很快就給答案!

3. language 語言。
I even used it to learn a new language! 我甚至用它學新的語言。
Korean. 韓語。
I wanted to understand Korean TV dramas better. 我想更懂韓劇。

4. learn 學習。
How much have you learned so far? 你到目前學了多少了?
Probably just enough to order food at a restaurant. 可能只夠在餐廳裡點菜。

你是怎麼用AI的呢? 請來跟我一起讀單字。
teacher老師 fast快速的 language語言 learn學習

title: First World Bird Fair Coming to Taiwan

content.en: Taiwan is a great country for birdwatchers. We have about seven hundred kinds of birds. We have ducks and geese! We have pigeons and doves! We have owls!
content.tw: 台灣是很適合賞鳥的國家，我們有七百種不同的鳥、鴨子、鵝、鴿子跟貓頭鷹！

content.en: Thirty kinds of birds are in Taiwan but not in other countries. We have Mikado pheasants. They are on the $1,000 Taiwan dollar bill. We have Swinhoe's pheasants. They are red, white, and blue, like our country's flag. They look like Mikado pheasants, but their legs are red.
content.tw: 其中三十種是台灣特有種，像是千元鈔票上的帝雉，還有藍腹鷴，全身紅白藍像國旗一樣！

content.en: Oh yes, and we have Taiwan blue magpies. They are also called "long-tailed mountain ladies." They are beautiful!
content.tw: 當然還有美麗的台灣藍鵲，綽號叫「長尾山娘」。

content.en: Lots of people love birdwatching. And soon, bird lovers from many countries will be flying to Taiwan. They are excited! Taiwan is excited too! The first World Bird Fair is coming! It will be in Taichung, on September twentieth and twenty first.
content.tw: 9月20跟21日，世界賞鳥博覽會將在台中舉辦，台灣跟世界賞鳥迷都會共襄盛舉！

content.en: One part of the fair is free. Everyone can go! We can learn about birdwatching, protecting birds, and helping nature.
content.tw: 一部分的博覽會是免費的，一起來了解賞鳥、鳥類保育的知識吧！

content.en: If you can't go, look at the birds where you live. What are they? Now you're a birdwatcher too!
content.tw: 如果你不能去，就看看你住處附近的鳥兒吧。牠們是什麼鳥呢？現在你也是個賞鳥人了！

vocabulary.preface: 台中市九月要舉辦第一屆的世界賞鳥博覽會。

content.text:
1. look at 注視。
I love looking at birds, but I don't like traveling too far.
我很喜歡看鳥，但是不喜歡跑很遠。
You don't have to. 不用啊!
There are some great birdwatching spots here in Taipei!
台北就有一些很棒的賞鳥地點。

2. duck 鴨子。
Really? Like where? 真的哦? 比如說哪裡?
The Botanical Garden is a good one. 植物園就很好。
You can see ducks, waterhens and hawks! 你可以看到鴨子，水雞和老鷹。

3. owl 貓頭鷹。
You're right, it is a great place! 你說得對，確實是很棒的地方。
I even saw an owl there once. 我有一次甚至在那裏看到貓頭鷹。

4. excited 興奮的。
No way! An owl? 不會吧，貓頭鷹?
Yeah, everybody was excited! 對啊，大家都好興奮!
So cool! 好酷喔!

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪幾個字?
look at注視 duck鴨子 owl貓頭鷹 excited興奮的

2. Where will the World Bird Fair be?
3. What month is the World Bird Fair?

title: Why Hula Hoops Don't Fall, Until They Do!

content.en: Playing with hula hoops is fun. You move your waist backward and forward fast. The hoop spins around and around your waist. It doesn't fall down! Do you know why?
content.tw: 搖呼拉圈很好玩，你有好奇過為什麼只要前後搖擺，呼拉圈就會繞著腰旋轉嗎?

content.en: Some scientists wanted to find out. They used robots. The robots moved like people move to spin hoops.
content.tw: 科學家想知道，所以他們讓機器人搖呼拉圈做實驗。

content.en: Some robots kept their hoops spinning. They had small waists. The scientists found the small waists made the hoops go up when the hoops were spinning. The hoops went around and around the small waists. They didn't fall down!
content.tw: 有些機器人腰細細的，它們怎麼搖呼拉圈都不會掉!

content.en: Other robots didn't have small waists. One looked like a can. One looked like an ice cream cone. Their hoops fell down.
content.tw: 其他的機器人沒有細腰，有的形狀像罐子，或像冰淇淋筒，它們一搖呼拉圈就掉。

content.en: Small waists are helpful for hula-hooping. But people can learn to hula-hoop with big waists or small waists. Using a big hoop is very important for learners.
content.tw: 沒有細腰還是可以搖呼拉圈，新手最好選很~大的圈圈來練習。

content.en: Here's how to hula-hoop. Start fast! Spin the hoop around your waist! Move with it! When it touches your front, move your waist forward. When it touches your back, move your waist backward.
content.tw: 呼拉圈有訣竅，開始時速度要快，之後順著呼拉圈搖，它碰到你的背部，就把腰往後搖，它碰到你的肚子，就往前搖!

content.en: Now you try it. Spin the hula hoop! Have fun!
content.tw: 現在你試試看。轉動呼拉圈！玩得開心！

vocabulary.preface: 搖呼拉圈是好玩的遊戲，也吸引了科學家來研究。

content.text:
1. fun 好玩的。
Hey, let's join this hula-hoop contest! 我們來參加呼拉圈比賽!
It looks like a lot of fun! 看起來很好玩!
It does, but I don't know how to hula-hoop. 沒錯，但是我不會玩呼拉圈。

2. spin 旋轉。
It's easy. 很簡單。
You just spin the hoop around by moving your waist.
你就動動腰，讓呼拉圈繞著腰轉圈圈。
So I just spin it and hope for the best? 所以我就轉，希望一切順利?

3. around and around 圍繞著。
Yeah, that's it. 對，就那樣。
But you want to move fast enough to keep it going around and around.
但是你要動得夠快，讓呼拉圈一直轉。

4. start 開始。

content.en: Joss paper is burned for gods and people who have passed away. It's also called ghost money.
content.tw: 紙錢是活人燒給神明和已經過世的人使用，又叫做冥紙。

content.en: Many people burn joss paper. They burn gold joss paper for gods. They burn silver joss paper for people who have passed away.
content.tw: 金色的紙錢獻給神明，銀色的則獻給已經過世的人。

content.en: Most joss paper is made with machines. But a shop in New Taipei makes it by hand. It has been making joss paper for more than 100 years.
content.tw: 大部分紙錢用機器做成，但新北市有一間店，堅持純手工製作超過 100 年。

content.en: The shop uses a machine to cut many papers at one time. But the workers put foil, paint, and red seals on each paper by hand.
content.tw: 他們只用機器裁切紙張，其他包括一張張上錫箔、塗漆或蓋印，都是純手工!

content.en: The shop's owner thinks about the environment. During the Lunar New Year, the Tomb Sweeping Festival, Ghost Month, and other times, many people burn joss paper.
content.tw: 每到新年、清明和鬼月，人們都需要燒紙錢，重視環保的老闆想到個好妙招!

content.en: So the shop uses bamboo paper and one kind of foil. These are better for the environment. It also puts a bigger foil on each paper. A bigger foil means a paper has a lot of ghost money. Then less joss paper is burned!
content.tw: 用竹子做紙和特殊錫箔比較環保，紙上貼大張的錫箔代表金額更高，這樣就少燒一點紙錢。

content.en: This 100-year-old shop is making its joss paper better and better!
content.tw: 這家百年老店的紙錢越做越好！

vocabulary.preface: 聰明的老闆，製造金額很高的紙錢，減少燃燒紙張。

content.text:
1. god 神明。
Why are you buying so much gold joss paper? 你怎麼買這麼多金紙錢?
Because I want to give gods a bonus. 因為我想給神明獎金。

2. better 更好的。
I want to thank them for helping me get better grades in school.
我要謝謝他們讓我的學校成績更好。
You did all the work and they got the money? 你做所有的工作，拿錢卻是他們?

3. ghost 鬼魂。
Hey, it's ghost money! 那是紙錢!
I don't want this money. 我可不要這種錢。
You're right. My bad. 你說得對。是我錯了。

4. use 使用。
Where do you think they would use the money? 你覺得他們會在哪裡用錢?
Maybe there's a shopping mall in heaven? 也許天上有購物商場?
I like that idea! 我喜歡這個主意。

今天的單字你記住了嗎?
god神明 better更好的 ghost鬼魂 use使用

title: A Day To Play Taiwan’s Indigenous Sports

content.en: Taiwan loves sports! We won the WBSC Premier12 last year! The World Masters Games were here this year.
content.tw: 台灣很喜歡運動，我們去年贏得世界棒球十二強，今年還舉辦世壯運!

content.en: Many people in Taiwan love baseball, basketball, and badminton. These sports have been in Taiwan for around one hundred years.
content.tw: 棒球、籃球和羽毛球都在台灣流行了快 100 年。

content.en: But what sports did people play before then? They played sports made by Taiwan's tribes. These are Indigenous sports.
content.tw: 但是更早之前，台灣人做什麼運動呢? 原住民有很豐富的傳統運動。

content.en: At one university, students can learn about Taiwan’s Indigenous sports. The university wants people to know and play these sports.
content.tw: 台灣一所大學，希望學生可以體驗傳統的原住民運動，更了解它們。

content.en: This year, an Indigenous class had a sports day at the university. Other students and teachers came. They played Indigenous sports!
content.tw: 今年，這個大學的原住民專班舉辦運動日，邀請全校師生一起體驗、學習!

content.en: They did wood sawing, spear throwing and pole pushing! They tried to walk and keep something heavy on their heads! That wasn't easy!
content.tw: 他們體驗鋸木頭、擲矛、推竿、還有在頭上頂著東西走路，努力保持平衡!

content.en: Everyone had fun playing Indigenous sports. They learned about the sports too. With days like this one, these sports may be played for a long, long time!
content.tw: 大家玩得很開心之外，也更認識這些運動，將它們傳承下去!

vocabulary.preface: 原住民的運動項目，跟一般的球類或是田徑很不一樣。

content.text:
1. Indigenous 原住民的。
Have you ever tried walking with something on your head?
你有試過在頭上頂個東西走路嗎?
No, it’ll fall. 沒有，它會掉下來。
Indigenous people can do it. 原住民可以。
It’s a sport. 它是一種運動。

2. heavy 沉重的。
So they just ran with something heavy on their heads?
所以他們就頭頂重重的東西賽跑?
Yeah, wouldn't it be fun? 是啊，會很好玩吧?

3. wood 木頭。
It would be fun to watch. 會很好看。
Here’s another sporting event. 這裡還有另外一種運動。
A wood sawing race. 鋸木頭比賽。

4. win 贏。
Oh, that’s my kind of sport! 那我就會了。
You know how to saw wood? 你會鋸木頭?
No, but I know I’ll win. 不會，但我知道我會贏。

來讀今天的單字。

content.en: Some dogs work at airports. Some dogs work for the police. Why? Dogs have good noses. They can smell things very well. They smell things much better than we can. They can smell things we cannot smell!
content.tw: 有的狗狗在機場工作，有的是警犬，因為牠們的鼻子靈敏，可以聞到我們聞不到的氣味。

content.en: Dogs also like smells that smell bad to us. Garbage smells bad to us. There can be old meat, fruit, bread, and other food in it. There can also be paper and plastic with old food on it. All of this smells good to dogs.
content.tw: 我們認為的臭味，像是廚餘或是垃圾，狗狗反而喜歡，因為裡面很可能有食物。

content.en: A long time ago, dogs hunted for food. Today's dogs like to hunt too. So they dig in the garbage. They are hunting for the food they smell. They pull things out of the garbage. They make a mess! But maybe they'll find the food!
content.tw: 以前，狗為了填飽肚子而狩獵，現在也是。牠們在垃圾裡面翻找，弄得一團亂！但也許能找到食物喔！

content.en: But garbage can have some dangerous things for dogs to eat. They can get sick. They can get hurt.
content.tw: 但垃圾裡可能有危險的東西，會弄傷牠們或讓牠們生病！

content.en: To keep your dog healthy and safe, make sure he cannot get into your kitchen garbage can.
content.tw: 所以為了你的狗狗好，不要讓牠進廚房翻垃圾哦！

content.en: Dogs aren't trying to be bad when they dig in the garbage. They are using their noses!
content.tw: 狗狗翻垃圾不是故意使壞。牠們只是在運用自己的鼻子！

vocabulary.preface: 狗狗喜歡翻垃圾堆，並不是因為想玩，而是想尋找食物。

content.text:
1. smell 氣味。
What's that smell? 那是什麼氣味? It's awful! 好難聞!
Sorry about that. 真抱歉。
My dog was going through the kitchen garbage. 我的狗剛剛在翻廚房垃圾。

2. hunt 打獵。
Why did you let it do that? 你怎麼會讓牠那樣?
I didn't. Charlie was only hunting for food. 我才沒有。查理只是在找食物。
That's what dogs do. 狗狗就那樣。

3. make sure 確定。
Even when you fed him well? 就算你把他餵飽也會?
Yeah. I guess he wanted to make sure there's nothing better to eat.
對，我猜他要確定沒有更好吃的東西。

4. bad 壞的。
So he's not a bad dog? 所以他不是壞狗?
Of course not. He's my good friend. 當然不。他是我的好朋友。

title: New Gum Helps Stop the Flu

content.en: Every year, many people catch the flu. Being sick isn't fun. But the flu is easy to catch. You can catch it when someone with the flu sneezes or coughs near you.
content.tw: 每年很多人得流感，只要病人咳嗽打噴嚏，身邊的人就可能被傳染！

content.en: Try not to catch the flu! There are things you can do. One thing is washing your hands a lot.
content.tw: 在流感期間勤洗手，可以保護你不生病。

content.en: But if you catch the flu, you can try to stop other people from getting sick. You can wear a mask. You can cover your mouth when you sneeze or cough. And you can chew gum. What? Chew gum?
content.tw: 要是得了流感，要戴口罩，把嘴巴捂住再咳嗽打噴嚏，保護其他人，還有嚼口香糖！咦？口香糖？

content.en: Okay, this is not the gum you can buy at stores. Scientists made this gum. It's a medicine. It's made from a pea plant!
content.tw: 不是便利商店那種口香糖喔！是有療效的口香糖，科學家從豌豆研發出來的。

content.en: How does this new gum work? Well, the flu is a virus. When you catch the flu, lots of the virus is in your mouth. When you chew this gum, it stops most of the virus from working. Other people won't catch the flu from you!
content.tw: 得流感的時候，病毒會在嘴巴裡，這種口香糖可以消滅那些病毒，就不會傳染給別人！

content.en: Scientists want to make gum for the bird flu and other viruses too. Let's hope they can!
content.tw: 科學家們也想為禽流感和其他病毒製造口香糖。讓我們期盼他們能成功吧！

vocabulary.preface: 這種特殊的口香糖，可以預防傳染疾病給別人。

content.text:
1. sneeze 打噴嚏。
I can't believe I have the flu again! 真不相信我又得了流感！
How do you know it's the flu? 你怎麼知道是流感？
You haven't sneezed or coughed. 你既沒打噴嚏也沒咳嗽。

2. sick 生病的。
Oh, those will come later. 那些之後就會來。
Right now I just have pain all over. 我現在是全身痛。
Oh no, then you're probably sick. 糟糕，那你很可能生病了。

3. medicine 藥品。
I know I'm sick. 我知道是生病了。
You should stay away from me. 你應該離我遠一點。
Can I get you some medicine? 我可以給你拿些藥嗎?

4. near 靠近。
No, don't come near me. 不要靠近我。
Go wash your hands and stay healthy. 去洗手，保持健康。

content.en: Maybe your school has swings. Two long chains hold a seat. You hold the chains. The seat is behind you. You move back a little. Then you sit and put your feet out! Whee!
content.tw: 你應該玩過學校的鞦韆，手抓緊鍊子，坐在椅子上，雙腳往前伸，然後往後彎，就可以飛好高！

content.en: The Chiayi festival swing is different from a school swing. The swing is made with bamboo and vines. There are no nails. There are no chains. But the swing is strong!
content.tw: 嘉義市鞦韆節很特別，鞦韆是用竹子跟藤蔓做的，沒有釘子或鐵鍊，卻很堅固！

content.en: And, the swing is 12 meters tall! Whoa! It is not easy to swing. The seat is two meters up! People climb up to the seat. One or two people get on it. They hold the bamboo on both sides of the seat. They squat down and stand up, squat down and stand up. They can swing 10 meters high! Yaaa-hoooo!
content.tw: 整座鞦韆有 12 公尺高，玩的人爬上2公尺高的椅子，反覆蹲下去再站起來，可以把鞦韆盪到高達 10 公尺！

content.en: Chiayi's festival started about two hundred years ago. Last year, women swung! It was their first time. This year, many men and women swung on the swing!
content.tw: 嘉義鞦韆節已經有兩百年歷史，去年第一次有女性玩家嘗試，今年男女都很踴躍參加！

content.en: Chiayi loves this festival. The tall swing is fun!
content.tw: 嘉義愛這個節日，這座高高的鞦韆很好玩！

vocabulary.preface: 盪鞦韆很好玩，嘉義鞦韆節的鞦韆更是特別。

title: Asteroid Won't Hit Earth, May Hit Moon

content.en: Scientists say something is flying in space. And it's near Earth. It's not a spaceship. It's not a plane. It's a rock! Huh?
content.tw: 科學家說地球附近有物體在飛，不是太空船或飛機，是一顆石頭！

content.en: Many rocks go around and around the sun. They are asteroids. Earth and other planets go around the sun too. But asteroids are much, much smaller.
content.tw: 很多石頭不停繞著太陽轉，叫做小行星。地球跟其他的行星也繞著太陽轉，不過小行星小很多。

content.en: Small asteroids can cause big problems. On June 30th, 1908, an asteroid killed eighty million trees!
content.tw: 小行星可能會釀成災害，1908 年 6 月 30日，一顆小行星撞地球，摧毀了 8 千萬棵樹！

content.en: Last year, scientists found an asteroid near Earth. They named it 2024 YR4. It is 53 to 67 meters wide. It looks like a pancake! Most asteroids look like potatoes.
content.tw: 去年，在地球附近有一顆被命名為 2024 YR4 的小行星，有 53 到 67 公尺寬，長得像扁扁的鬆餅，大部分小行星都像馬鈴薯。

content.en: At first, scientists worried about 2024 YR4. Was it going to hit Earth? But don't worry! Now scientists say it won't hit Earth. Whew! We are safe! But scientists also say the asteroid may hit the moon in 2032!
content.tw: 科學家原本擔心它會撞地球，好消息是我們很安全！不過它可能會在 2032 年撞到月球。

content.en: Hey, it's June 30th again! That means today is International Asteroid Day! Do you want something to do this summer? Find out more about asteroids!
content.tw: 嘿，又是六月三十日！今天是國際小行星日！你想在這個夏天做些什麼嗎？了解更多關於小行星的事吧！

vocabulary.preface: 小行星撞地球並不是只有在電影中，它真的可能發生

content.text:
1. worry 擔憂。
Imagine an asteroid hitting Earth. Boom! 想像一顆小行星撞地球，砰！
Don't joke about it. 不要開玩笑。
What? Do you really worry about it? 什麼，你真的擔心?
Yeah, I do. 是，我擔心。

2. planet 行星。
But it's not going to happen. 但是不會發生啊。
How can you be so sure? 你怎麼那麼確定?
Well, Earth is just a small planet. 地球只是一個小小的行星。
The universe is very big. 宇宙很大呢。

3. spaceship 太空船。
I think scientists should build many spaceships.
我覺得科學家應該造很多太空船。

4. summer 夏天。
So that we can fly away anytime? 好讓我們隨時飛走?
Yeah, like going on a summer vacation.
對，就好像去過暑假。

上完這一課，你就可以放假了！來一起讀單字。
